intro: Duvalia sulcata subsp. sudanensis, commonly known as the Sudanese sandbur, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that protect its seeds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers in the summer months. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with deep root systems and minimal water requirements. This subspecies is often found in sandy soils and is used in some regions for its hardy nature and ornamental value.
